result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit a DNA sample to the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is to set up a payment plan when he is released from custody or when he is back into the United States.

Jail sentence shall begin immediately.  Jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence is concurrent with any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Copy request from Homeland Security
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Rivera indicated that he would like to proceed without a Spanish interpreter.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 2 to Misd intimidate a victim - 940.44(1).  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 2, 3 and 4  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 2, 3 and 4.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders count 2 - 90 days county jail; court costs DNA sample and SC; Count 3 - 90 days county jail consecutive to count 2; court costs - Count 4 - 90 days county jail consecutive to counts 2 and 3; court costs.  Jail sentence is with huber and good time.  168 days sentence credit.  Jail sentence is concurrent to any other sentence that defendant may be serving.  - rt

for Samuel Rivera-Meza

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with G.J.R. - dob: 5-7-1990.
Initial Appearance on January 26, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samuel Rivera-Meza appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for the arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $10,000.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with G.J.R. - dob:  5-7-90.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is an initial appearance on January 26, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
